channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: GoWish’s shopping and wishlist app is having its biggest year yet
item.description: GoWish, an app for making wishlists, is having a record year, and has doubled its users.

item.title: Fat Savings on the Super Skinny Razer Blade 14 Gaming Laptop
item.description: You could save hundreds on Razer's sleek gaming laptop with an OLED upgrade.

item.title: The First ‘KPop Demon Hunters’ Dolls Are Here—But There’s a Huge Catch
item.description: Pre-orders open through Mattel Creations on November 12.

item.title: World of Warcraft is getting a new kind of fake money
item.description: The long-awaited addition of Housing in World of Warcraft is going to cost you. On top of your monthly subscription and the cost of the Midnight expansion itself, some Housing items will require a new in-game currency called “Hearthsteel” that players will have to pay for with real money. World of Warcraft already has hundreds […]

item.title: Spirit Christmas is back with 30 pop-up stores: Full list of locations for your holiday shopping needs
item.description: As retail heads into its busiest and most profitable season, Spirit is pivoting from Halloween to lawn Santas, nutcrackers, and ugly festive sweaters. With Black Friday just about three weeks away, retailers and shoppers have one thing on their mind—Christmas, the busiest and most profitable time of the year.

item.title: Pas de suspension pour Shein, qui reste sous haute surveillance
item.description: Suite, et probablement pas fin, de la saga Shein. La plateforme d'ultra-fashion chinoise ne propose désormais plus de « produits illicites » dans ses rayons, ce que le gouvernement a reconnu. Elle n'en reste pas moins sous haute surveillance, que ce soit en France ou en Europe.

item.title: Sweetgreen’s dream of being a tech company is finally dead
item.description: The salad chain has long pitched itself as something more than just a boring, old restaurant company. With the sale of its automated bowl assembly tech, guess what? On November 6, Sweetgreen announced that it was selling Spyce, its division that developed and made its Infinite Kitchen technology to automate the assembly of its bowls and salads. The acquirer is Wonder, the “restaurant and mealtime superapp,” as Fast Company dubbed it earlier this year....

item.title: Palantir CEO Says a Surveillance State Is Preferable to China Winning the AI Race
item.description: He also had strong opinions about people's "god-given" rights to eat a hotdog and flirt with someone who isn't their spouse.

item.title: 13 Best Deals From the All-Clad Factory Seconds Sale on Kitchen Must-Haves (2025)
item.description: All-Clad cookware is the best you can buy—and it has a price tag to match. This sale will stretch your dollars, but it ends soon.

item.title: Disney World’s new Zootopia experience is fun, fast, and full of fur – literally, thanks to one incredible animatronic
item.description: TechRadar had the chance to preview the new 4D show ahead of its opening, experiencing the production – created by the same animation team behind Zootopia 2 – and getting an up-close look at an all-new animatronic from Walt Disney Imagineering.

item.title: After more than 200 years, the Farmers’ Almanac is shutting down for good
item.description: The iconic guide for American gardeners and farmers has published its final issue. Since 1818, loyal readers of the Farmers’ Almanac have turned to the publication for weather predictions, gardening tips, astronomy calendars, and more. But, on November 6, the Farmers’ Almanac announced that the 2026 edition of the magazine will be its last.

item.title: Washington Post confirms data breach linked to Oracle hacks
item.description: The Washington Post is the latest victim of a hacking campaign by the notorious Clop ransomware gang, which relied on vulnerabilities in Oracle software used by many corporations.

item.title: The massive Currys Black Friday sale is here – I've picked the 19 best deals on TVs, appliances, laptops, headphones, and more
item.description: I've searched through the Curry Black Friday sale and hand-picked 19 of the best deals that I'd buy on TVs, appliances, laptops, headphones, and more.

item.title: Trump admin appeals judge’s order requiring full SNAP benefits
item.description: The administration says it should only have to pay 65% of food stamp benefits this month due to funding shortfalls tied to the government shutdown. The Trump administration isn’t backing down from its refusal to fully fund the SNAP program – even after being ordered to by a judge on Thursday.

item.title: Dan Trachtenberg on Why He Wants to Continue Making ‘Predator’ Movies
item.description: The director's third 'Predator' movie, 'Predator: Badlands,' is now in theaters.

item.title: Cornell University Will Pay $60 Million to Unlock Research Funds Frozen by White House
item.description: The administration has come after researchers at institutions across the country.

item.title: Welcome to Big Tech's ‘Age of Extraction’
item.description: In his new book, antitrust scholar and former White House adviser Tim Wu argues that tech giants are bleeding you dry—and lays out a plan to stop them.

item.title: How to watch Grand Slam of Darts 2025 online: live streams, schedule
item.description: As the world's best players head to Wolverhampton, here's how to watch Grand Slam of Darts 2025 live streams online from anywhere in the world.

item.title: These VPN deals blew us away over the last few years – will they be beaten in 2025?
item.description: After tracking VPN deals for years, I know how to spot a real VPN deal.

item.title: Wendy’s closing hundreds of locations: List of fast food casualties in 2025 grows longer
item.description: The burger chain said in its earnings call Friday that it will shutter some 200 to 350 underperforming restaurants, starting this year. Wendy’s announced plans to close a “mid-single-digit percentage” of its underperforming U.S. store locations, or 200 to 350 of some 6,000 locations, during its quarterly earnings call on Friday.

item.title: Blackmagic’s free camera app can now stream directly to YouTube and Twitch
item.description: Blackmagic released an update to its free camera app with some new features that streamers and professional broadcasters will appreciate. Both the Android and iOS versions of the Blackmagic Camera app can now stream directly to YouTube, Twitch, and Vimeo, removing the need for third-party apps or additional encoding hardware. You just need to select […]...

item.title: I tried the Apple Crossbody Strap. It’s convenient, but the phone looks silly when the strap is removed.
item.description: Apple's new Crossbody Strap is a convenient way to go hands-free but the strap can rub uncomfortably at times, and the phone looks silly when the strap is removed.

item.title: Social Security Employees Grill Management During Tense Shutdown Meeting
item.description: WIRED obtained notes from a Social Security Administration management meeting, where employees pressed leadership on plans for the agency.

item.title: Linda Hamilton Was Considering Retirement Before ‘Stranger Things’ Came Along
item.description: The sci-fi legend takes on a villainous role in the Netflix show's fifth and final season.

item.title: Anker’s 521 PowerHouse can power up to six devices, and it’s on sale
item.description: From weekend camping trips to unexpected power outages, having a reliable power source like the Anker 521 PowerHouse can be a lifesaver. Normally $249.99, right now you can buy the power station for the new low price of $128.99 at checkout at Amazon. The power station is essentially a portable backup battery with a 256Wh […]
